title: What Matters to You
description: Sort eight life domains into what matters most, least, and somewhere in between. This card-sort exercise helps you see your values clearly — not what you think you should care about, but what actually lights you up.

steps.title: The Quiet Question
steps.content: Most of us rush through life without stopping to ask a simple question: what actually matters to me? Not what our parents wanted, not what social media celebrates — but what makes us feel alive and aligned. Today, you're going to find out.

steps.title: Values Are Directions, Not Destinations
steps.content: In Acceptance and Commitment Therapy, values are like a compass — they point you in a direction, but you never "arrive" at them the way you finish a goal. You can always move toward kindness, growth, or connection. Values aren't right or wrong. They're personal. Two people can live meaningful lives with completely different value sets. The key is knowing yours so you can make choices that feel like you.
steps.keyTakeaway: Values are ongoing directions you travel in, not boxes you check off.

steps.title: Sort Your Life Domains
steps.content: Below are eight life domains. Drag each card into the bucket that feels right. Go with your gut — there are no wrong answers. If you're torn, notice that tension. It's useful information.
steps.exercisePrompt: Sort each life domain into how important it feels to you right now.

exerciseItems.label: Family & Relationships
exerciseItems.description: Close bonds with family, partner, or chosen family

exerciseItems.label: Career & Work
exerciseItems.description: Meaningful work, professional growth, financial stability

exerciseItems.label: Health & Wellbeing
exerciseItems.description: Physical fitness, mental health, rest, and nourishment

exerciseItems.label: Creativity & Expression
exerciseItems.description: Making things, art, writing, music, or creative problem-solving

exerciseItems.label: Spirituality & Inner Life
exerciseItems.description: Faith, meditation, sense of meaning, or connection to something larger

exerciseItems.label: Community & Belonging
exerciseItems.description: Friendships, social groups, contributing to your neighborhood or culture

exerciseItems.label: Adventure & Fun
exerciseItems.description: New experiences, travel, play, spontaneity, and joy

exerciseItems.label: Learning & Growth
exerciseItems.description: Curiosity, education, skill-building, and personal development

steps.title: What Do You Notice?
steps.content: Take a breath and look at your sorted cards. There's no perfect arrangement — just honest information about where you are right now.

reflectPrompts.prompt: Was anything surprising about where you placed a card? What stood out?
How aligned does your daily life feel with your 'Very Important' domains?
Did you feel pulled between any two domains? Which ones?

steps.title: One Small Step Toward What Matters
steps.content: Pick one domain from your 'Very Important' bucket. Choose one tiny action you can take today — something that takes five minutes or less — to move in that direction.
steps.commitPrompt: Today, I'll take five minutes to honor one of my top values by...
commitOptions: Texting someone I love to say I'm thinking of them
Taking a short walk outside to invest in my health
Spending five minutes learning something new that excites me
